website_summaries.verdict: This helpful pack showcases an urban, neutral design with adequate storage.
pros: Includes two large, zippered pockets and two semi-open pockets for easy access to items
cons: Can only be used with medium to large dogs

customer_reviews.title: Enslave your dog to carry his own sh*t
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is a lifesaver if you take your dog hiking/camping. When I take my dog hiking, more often than not I'm carrying my food his food, my water, his water, bowl, lash, poop bags, toys like his personal walking luggage. A 70lb pitbull and husky mix, who is completely capable of carrying his own sh*t, is looking down on me because I'm hiking up the hills too damn slow. Since this backpack, he gets tired when I get tired. Because I am making him carry his own things. Guess your endurance wasn't as good as you thought it wad huh Dog.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Chan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic item. Fits my medium sized lab (55 lbs) ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic item. Fits my medium sized lab (55 lbs) very well. Lots of pockets for her gear. Balanced very well - stays in place and inline.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Everett

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My dog has always been a puller. First I tried a harness, which was a massive failure that made it easier for him to yank my arm around. Then I bought a gentle leader. That is actually an amazing product that works, but he still had some bad moments where something would distract him. After putting this pack on him and "giving him a job" its like there is an invisible wall right next to me and he doesnt ever walk past me and doesn't even try to pull or mark bushes anymore. 6 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Spudouken

customer_reviews.title: Great for 4 days
customer_reviews.text: It looked as though it was going to be a GREAT dog bag back. Looked super sturdy and fit my dog well! After 1 week of use, it broke. Took my 80# Newfoundland/RottWeiler to the dog park (Day 4 or 5 of use), and as soon as he brushed against the gate, one of the loops ripped out of the pack. Haven't had time to try to return yet, but will update review afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn la Rue

customer_reviews.title: Broke first use!
customer_reviews.text: Looked like it would be sturdy, it wasn't. Broke in two places during the first use. First, the zipper broke. Second, the strap that holds the left bag ripped which caused the bag to be useless. The bag only had in it a collapsible dog bowl and two small Gatorade bottles filled with water. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Jake McCane

customer_reviews.title: Best pack for the price, gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Use this pack on my Husky/German Shepherd for day and snow hikes. Here's the quick breakdown: Pros: -Lots of space in the pack -Pretty snug fit -Simple to use -Gets the job done -Affordable Cons: -Feels like it could be more "comfortable" for my dog -Not waterproof at all.. gets wet, heavy, and soggy in the snow -Straps hang down with no reliable way to tuck them in With that said... Tigris - I have a TON of high-quality product shots from my snow hike if you're interested in using them. Feel free to reach out to me at kylelaffeyfilm@gmail.com Cheers, Xmo
customer_reviews.author: Xmo

customer_reviews.title: Got a different design...dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Got a different product than ordered. What I ordered was what’s pictured the hoppy pack with one neck strap and one belly strap. What I got was quite different and had two belly straps instead of one that goes in the middle of belly the first one goes under the front legs and second further back. I’ve tried this design with other harnesses and my bull dog hates that front strap that sits right behind his legs and it impedes his movement. No time to return backpack trip in two days going to try to use it without the front belly straps. I just wanted what was pictured feel like I got duped and am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Do not buy!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for my disabled veterans service dog. It was for our backpack hiking weekend. I received the item on 4/13/18. My husband was really excited to try it out before the trip. He didn't even make it down the street and the main strap broke!!!!! It had a collapsible bowl and two small empty water bottles. How disappointing!!!!! Not only did it ruin my birthday gift but also our trip. Very poor quality and dangerous to your dog. BUYER BEWARE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Em807

customer_reviews.title: If Manufacturer would use better quality thread, I would rate this 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cross the belly straps; don't attach them laterally. I have a large, long legged dog. Excessive, danglinIf strap length is irritating. No dog fat enough to use up that much strap length would should be out hiking. Design is excellent. It is comfortable, but if the manufacturer would use better quality thread in sewing on the loops, I would give this five stars. Stitching disintegrated after half dozen uses and had to take it to shoe repair shop to have it fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lowther

customer_reviews.title: the only issue I have is it always goes lopsided ...
customer_reviews.text: the only issue I have is it always goes lopsided on my dog after a while of her wearing it. Ive tried adjusting it many times and even buckling it on her differently but it does not give up. my friend has the same backpack and it does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Alex McKay

customer_reviews.title: Strap tore off during second use :(
customer_reviews.text: I loved this pack on my dog. He's a 1 year old German shepherd mix, so he has tons of energy. I put a water bottle in each side to help tire him out during obedience training, and one of the front canvas loops tore off. The threading is coming lose on the other loop. It's too bad because it was a nice backpack, but it tore apart the second time he wore it. I'm past the return window, so I'm going to try sowing it back together, but I'm not very good at that.
customer_reviews.author: rae

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Quality
customer_reviews.text: The material, construction, and design of the backpack are all amazing. Everything is very high quality, especially when you count in the price. The complaints are; the instructions not being clear lose it a star. I would have assumed it pretty straightforward but shockingly some straps are placed in unusual angles making it confusing. The second star deduction comes from the dog. He absolutely hates the vest and will barely walk in it. I am not sure why there seems to be no rubbing points.
customer_reviews.author: ACE

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for fun and hiking, big time space saver.
customer_reviews.text: Great pack for my dog, I bought the large for my 90+ pound German shepherd. Mainly bought it for exercise, add weight to the pockets on walks and during play time. I like to take him on hikes with me, plenty of room for food, bags, water, treats etc. pockets are very big, two deep side pockets and an inner zipper pocket inside one side pocket great for smaller items such as phone, keys or wallet. Two D-ring clipping points on top of bag can be used for clipping leash or portable water/food bowls. Overall great product, high quality material and stitching. Great bargain on price.
customer_reviews.author: David Rubio

customer_reviews.title: Fits A Rhodesian Ridgeback!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the size and whether or not it would fit my 77# dog. Well, it fits great. It is well made and I do not foresee any problems with holding her food, water and other essentials. The pack has inside zip pockets, like a ladies purse! Large zip and Velcro pockets as well. We are looking forward to using it soon. Add Rhodesian Ridgeback to the list of breeds this pack accommodates. The straps have lots of room for expansion for these chow hounds too.
customer_reviews.author: LSU Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! We took our 65lb lab mix out hiking with it last week and it stayed on. I like that the collar piece helps keep the bag anchored on our pup but I almost wish there was extra reinforcement down from the center of the collar the way harnesses secure pups. I feel like it would help keep it from swaying side to side that way. Also, I would not suggest using the metal hook to attach your leash if your dog likes to pull. We put his harness on underneath and attached it to that instead.
customer_reviews.author: Beeda

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS!!!! Absolutely love this pack ! I purchased this for my service dog since I did not want a traditional service dog vest and I needed something to carry my personal items so I did not have to use a purse. If I could change one thing, it would be the placement of the buckles on the belly. I would have them position more to the side of the dog versus directly underneath, For ease of buckling and for comfort of the dog. I use my seatbelt cover for her belly protection and that seems to work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So great!
customer_reviews.text: Our 70lb pitbull is very anxious, distractible, and does not walk well on a leash. He's constantly stopping, starting, lunging, etc. Our dog training recommended this, and it has done wonders for us! We put 2.5lb disc weights in both side pockets (which is appropriate for his weight), and it gives him a "job" to do. He's oriented and focused. It's amazing! His pulling has lessened by 75%, and with ongoing training, should resolve completely. He LOVES his backpack. As soon as we take it out he is excited and ready to go! Not to mention he looks so handsome with it on. And he carries his own poop bags :)
customer_reviews.author: Mariah T

customer_reviews.title: SEAM RIPPED IN HALF, TERRIBLE QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality. I put this on my 60-lb lab for a hike for the first time. After about 2 miles the seam near the handle on the top completely ripped open. I only had about 4 lbs in each side. He was running with it on for part of the time, but it should be able to withstand a dog running. I am going to buy Ruff Wear instead. Talked to someone who had this on their lab for 5 years and never had a problem. DO NOT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Nice bags
customer_reviews.text: These are the only dog saddlebags I've ever used, so I don't have much to compare them too. They've held up well so far. Our dog (yellow lab) doesn't mind wearing them at all. It's a little big on him but stays in place pretty well, and as he's not a year old yet they seem to be the right fit for that sized dog. The rings are nice so that we can clip carabiners to the rings so that we can attach other things to the outside of the saddlebags and hang them easily. It's a convenient way to free up space in our backpacks by not having to carry his food and water dishes and dog bags ourselves.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Weak Stitching
customer_reviews.text: When I read reviews for this product a lot of people mentioned the stitching on the handle ripping off but I didn't really like the handle so I went ahead and bought it. At first I loved it, great material good size etc but after a couple weeks of use one of the buckle straps ripped off. Really is a shame because if they just used stronger stiching I would give the product 5 stars. I hope they fix the problem because it has the potential to be a great saddle bag for your little pack mule.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Had This Sooner
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I originally rated this product five stars, but it has now torn after two hikes totaling 10 miles. Two hikes is all this pack can take, apparently, and both times the bag held two bottles of water, a fold out bowl and a small bag of treats. That's it. My 90 pound Golden Retriever wore this pack for a long mountain hike and could have cared less he was carrying his own water and snacks. Critical component: it stayed in place even when I had to hold it. Yes, that handle comes in handy on busy trails.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and very durable!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Cotton-Dog pack and it fits great on our dog! Seems comfortable for him. He can wear it all day. On hotter days we put ice packs in each pocket. Keeps him cool on walks as he heats up quickly. Plenty of room for storing his water and ours! His neck size is 19 inches and chest is 35 inches. The straps are easy to adjust and do no dig into his neck or under arms. Easy to wash too! Just throw it in the washer if it gets too dirty. We've had this pack for several years and looks new still. Great quality and very durable. Awesome product and definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Luciana A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack for a Day Hike
customer_reviews.text: This pack was a great size and fit for my large, 70lb mix breed dog. My dog wore this on a full day hike, and never seemed uncomfortable and had no rubbing issues. The pack was a great size to fit our sandwiches, dog food/treats, and a collapsible water bowl. As long as the weight was distributed evenly between the pouches on each side, the pack stayed centered on my dog. The fabric felt like a nice quality and has rings to easily attach a leash. I was really pleased with how well this worked for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Nutshellortwo

customer_reviews.title: Fits my dog well
customer_reviews.text: Got this one to use instead of a previous Tigris vest. It fits better on my slender Belgian Malinois, and very importanty, does not slide forward on my dogs body like the other vest did. She is clearly more comfortable because she does not try to take it off. The pockets are great. Big clasps make for easy on and off. I empty the pockets, put the vest on, then slip in two 1-lb weights. This keep my dog from jumping our 6-foot fence. And she looks GREAT in it. Will use it for hikes in the future. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Picky gal

customer_reviews.title: Dog Harness
customer_reviews.text: First harness that I purchased for my dog. Use it at least once a week in the summer and a few times during the winter. The dog doesn't mind it. Plenty of straps to secure it well. Had to cut the straps shorter, but would rather have to take material away than not have enough. Straps don't loosen by themselves, so the fit remains the same each use. Harness has started to show some wear, but would happily buy this product again when this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: S. Clusman

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Australian cattle dog, he is 40lbs. It worked for him to carry his own water and bowl at the renaissance festival. If he was any smaller though it wouldnt fit. I knew that i was cutting it close. The quality is excellent though and the straps stayed all the way tight on him without slipping. It can get a little hot with it being canvas so i made sure to give him breaks from it. The pockets are huge, it can hold 2 bottles of water in each side. I love this pack overall and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: B.OgleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bags, wish instructions were included
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best thing I have bought for my pup yet. 75# seven month old black lab. He gets so excited as soon as I pick up his shoulder bags to pack them for a walk. He Carries all his own stuff, and most of mine too. Only complaint is that the cinch straps pull loose if he gets excited. Not sure what all the extra velcro on the straps is for but doesn't stop them from loosening. Still an A+ purchase in my book
customer_reviews.author: SpencerTeri

customer_reviews.title: The price was ok but it's more fashion vs functional
customer_reviews.text: Was honestly disappointed. I have had other dog backpacks in the past. Most of a harness system across the chest for stabilization. This doesn't and it moves and slips. As well, the clip on the harness can't be used for a leash. It is not reinforced, and our dog ripped it out the middle. The price was ok but it's more fashion vs functional.
customer_reviews.author: Mellissa Landrum

customer_reviews.title: Super Doggie Pack
customer_reviews.text: No regrets. Very well made. My dog has a large chest cavity and is hard to fit, but this worked for her. Doesn't slip around too much. Enough room for 4 water bottles, treats, and poo bags. I do wish the neck band was a little lower. She is a puller and it chokes her just a little. But no issues with chaffing at all on two 6 mile hikes. It even stood up to her rolling in some swampy mud to cool off.
customer_reviews.author: CMA

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but the straps should be adjustable on both ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but the straps should be adjustable on both sides not just one. I have both straps as tight as they will go and it works however I think they should make a Medium size or re-design the straps. Overall though this thing is solid and worth every penny and looks great on my dog. My dog is 55lbs and works but the very rear strap is slightly too big. This however can be fixed with some cutting and re-sewing the straps\buckles as needed.
customer_reviews.author: DTS

customer_reviews.title: Nice for daily walks not hiking.
customer_reviews.text: This pack seems to be very well made, it has held up to six pounds on daily walks so far. I wouldn't use it for climbing steep hills. It doesn't have a strap to hold down the chest strap and on steeper climbs the pack can slide back against the dogs throat. I solved the problem with an old collar connecting the chest and birth straps when hiking. But for running around the neighborhood to wear her out it has been great. I had a Rottweiler Bassett bound mix and she is hard to fit. The lack has a wide back and is very stable side to side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great back pack
customer_reviews.text: I received this a couple of days ago, the dog and I walked over 7 miles today and it was great. We did a few shorter walks, I put one water bottle in each side (it will fit two in each side), her portable bowl, and poop bags. She carried her own things, she got tired more quickly than usual, and looked adorable! The only reason I didn't give it five stars is I'm going to take it apart in order to make the straps short enough to fit snugly on SheRa, she is a 45# husky, all the straps are dragging on the ground, and the one for her back isn't able to get small enough to fit her.
customer_reviews.author: BriarRose

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack! Leash Ring Ripped Off Though...
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months use Likes: - great to have my dog carry his own supplies on hikes/outings - dog pack holds on to dog fairly well - great look on dog Dislikes: - metal ring for leash are not strong and one has already ripped off embarrassingly - if the pack is unbalanced it may slope to one side - harness becomes loose if not secured very well
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Hoang

customer_reviews.title: Great pack!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Made of durable canvas type of material that has survived the treks of multiple hashes. Be aware that this is definitely not waterproof so when your pup is splashing around it will soak up water very quickly. Just remember to balance your load and adjust the straps accordingly. Its durably made and i am able to use the handle on the back to help lift my 80 pound German Shepherd out of bogs and muddy areas.
customer_reviews.author: brian mcgee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pack
customer_reviews.text: Great pack! Have had it for about 6m now and it looks so small on my 90lb German Shepherd but fits all his essentials, 2 water bottles, collapsible bowl, extra bags, all with plenty of extra room for more. Before purchasing this I saw a few reviews with quality concerns however I can say this pack is very well built and I'm not worried about it falling apart at all, that is unless the land shark sinks his teeth into it not much survives those! Anyway from my experience with my first OneTigris product I have and will buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: todd

customer_reviews.title: Giving my dog an intentional walk
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend and I have pitbull, and from what I know, Pit bull terriers are built with extreme determination to sprint, jump, and pull. Before the harness, our dog would walk ahead a lot with some pulling especially when squirrels are present. As soon as the harness is on him, his energy and attitude changes and he's ready to serve. Rarely ever does he pull and he sticks by our side. Bonus: It also make walks a bit shorter and he carries his own food, water, and toys.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper Vang

customer_reviews.title: He loves his pack!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the fit. Fitz loves it as well from the moment I put it in him. He didn’t even bat an eye, and was ready to go. Fitz has hiked and ran miles with his pack on and loves it. While the material isn’t rain proof, it did protect my phone from a torrential downpour we got caught in during a hike. Dirt and mud easily brush off after it’s dried. Zippers feel strong and sturdy. Very pleased, and anticipate it lasting us a very long time. FYI he is 7months old and 80lbs. Purchased the large.
customer_reviews.author: Shopgirl

customer_reviews.title: Style is Important!
customer_reviews.text: Super nice bag! Practical but style is also important! I bought the brown one for my black German Shepard! It looks like she can grow bigger and still fit it! She is currently a 7 month old 55lbs GSD. There are many pockets inside and pretty much bang for your bucks for the price. If you don’t wanna stuff your pockets with potty bags and water cups, make your pup carry it! 😂
customer_reviews.author: Peter Khoi Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Take it off before they go in the water
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great on my Wirehaired pointing griffon (Fred). He gets it on and is immediately turned into Mr. Serious. He knows he is going on a hike and has a job to do. He loves to work (and play). I would advise you to take it off before laying in the water. It has plenty of room for his collapsible bowls, food, water, and other small items. It is rugged canvas and stitched well. This is not a harness, I has a separate collar for his leash (when applied). All in All, fantastic buy. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff & Jon

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Fits my dog well. Make sure you tighten it correctly and your dog won't escape, no matter how stubborn they are. I put some weight, water, and a portable bowl in the pockets and it works great. He gets his water when he's thirsty and he has to work a bit harder on his walks because he's high energy. He even pulls less normally with the added weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kat T

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give it three stars but I misjudged the size of my dog so it's not the seller's fault it was too big for him, so four stars for the apparent quality. It's a very nice pack, it seems sturdy enough for hikes and stuff though I haven't actually been able to try it out, and you can fit a decent amount of things in the pockets.
customer_reviews.author: DameEdna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Easily adjusts & high quality
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about it being too big and the straps hanging due to other reviews but the straps actually have a velcro thing on them that way if there’s extra you can roll it up! So it’s PERFECT!! My pit is 50lbs now at 6 months so I’m sure she’ll grow and it fits her now and I’m positive it’ll fit her later. Would fit 40 to 90 pound dog give or take pretty easily. It’s comfy for her, breathable, easily adjusts, and super high quality! I recommend getting this.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Newman

customer_reviews.title: 5 star sturdy canine backpack
customer_reviews.text: OK, waited one year to write this review and...5 stars. This is the best dog backpack we've ever had. Appreciate the vinyl ones we were first introduced to but when we went to this one we had hopes it would last a bit longer than 3 months. It has. It's a year in and still perfect. And we use it as a 'weighted vest' with approx 15 lbs in there right now.
customer_reviews.author: Blitzed

customer_reviews.title: a gotta have for your dog when hiking...
customer_reviews.text: I "and my dog " love this saddle bag.. It can fit my dogs "COMPLETE " first aid kit along with brushes and tick/ mosquito Repellent and removal kit. Along with doodle bags and spare cell phone batteries... I water Proofed It. And treat it with tick repellent... my dog loves when I grab this bag.... because she knows were going to be gone for at least " minimum " 4hrs... Tuff little bag...... love it! Also---the bag has 4-D rings. Which can be used to create a sling to carry my dog out of the trails to the vet....
customer_reviews.author: jl5150

customer_reviews.title: I was pleased with the quality of the pack
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to give our lab mix a "job" to do during our hikes. I was pleased with the quality of the pack. The canvas is very soft and it was easy to adjust and put on him. He looks adorable in it and we were able to stash the following in it on our hikes: two water bottles, poop bags, dog treats, and a portable/collapsible water bowl. After reading some reviews, we did not attach his leash to the pack but to his collar instead (did not want to potentially rip the backpack). Overall, very happy with this purchase and I'm sure it will last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Twinnie B.

customer_reviews.title: Looks sturdy, but fails miserably as a harness.
customer_reviews.text: Took it for a test run at a local park before actual hiking with it. Leashed it up on the top ring and set off. My dog saw another dog about 10 minutes in, and pulled a bit to try to say hello. Tore right down the middle. Lasted about 15 minutes :( So then I put on his usual dog Kurgo harness, and when he got excited and saw deer (REALLY EXCITED), it was absolutely fine. I'd say if you own it already, definitely don't use it as a harness. Clip it in to a collar. If you don't own it, don't buy it. Sure 'looks' nice though.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and spacious
customer_reviews.text: I've now used both the canvas and nylon types from OneTigris. They are both quite sturdy. I have a 100lb husky that puts them to the test. I much prefer the look and feel of the canvas pack, but the nylon pack has some great advantages as well (more pockets, bag dispenser, the leash clip feels sturdier). I like these bags quite a bit. The one complaint I have is that there isn't a great way to balance the pack, so it seems to frequently tip to one side or the other. But I don't know that I've ever seen a pack that won't do that.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pack. The quality is wonderful, it looks really classy on the dogs as well. I will say that I had to go to the tightest setting on the stomach buckles and the loosest on the chest, which makes me think maybe they should offer more sizing. If Paulie was any larger, the chest would not have buckled and if he was any thinner the pack would have been too large in the stomach area.
customer_reviews.author: roxanne gazes

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for the $$
customer_reviews.text: I’m only giving this pack 4 stars because it hasn’t been tested by my pup long term, but so far so good! We just took it on a two night backpacking trip and it held up well. For those that have complained that the pack slips, it did for us too until the weight was balanced - but that’s a problem for the user, not the pack...plus balanced weight will make life easier for the pup.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: GREAT backpack for the price.  Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT backpack. My German Shepherd/Malinois mix can haul her own water and supplies on hikes. It does not shift, and is comfortable for her to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Denise M.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok doggie backpack. The bags themselves are fine, but there is nothing to help keep the bags in place, so they scoot to the sides constantly, even if they are evenly weighted. A lot of pressure goes under the neck - nothing to stop the neck strap from choking. Also, hair sticks to it so badly!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little smaller than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: I was worried it might be too big on my 56lb border collie, but after trying it on I wish it were a little bigger actually. The straps were easy to fit on him comfortably and it doesnt slide around or bother him at all. I've taken him on a couple walks with it so far and it seems hold up fine, its a nice thick canvas material that seems to be stitched up good. I purchased this to take him hiking so he can help carry his food and water and stuff like that. Everything is great and I am definitely happy with this pack, I'll update my review once we go hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M

customer_reviews.title: Finally found the perfect one
customer_reviews.text: Our chocolate lb is 57 lb. this back pack fits perfectly with more room to spare. The previous back packs we bought all tend to move to one side when she shakes or starts walking. This particular design with additional loop around the neck helps stablize the bag and Very easy to put on
customer_reviews.author: Sup

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, classy, rugged look!
customer_reviews.text: Very classy thick cotton material. Reminds me of an old-school military pack. Not allot of room for a heavy duty hiking. To give you an idea for capacity it can hold about 4 bottles of water total. But if you know how to pack a bag you can fit a small combination of items for a small day trip. It's great for walking him around town though! He gets lots of compliments! He's a 53lb pup and the straps can support a quick lift if needed. It's a great starter pack and I'm looking forward to purchasing from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer buffgeekbilbo

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pockets. Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: A little to big for my skinny chocolate lab but I like all the pockets. It even has smaller zipper pockets inside the large saddle bag zipper pockets. If your dog is a tugger don't use this as a harness my 1st harness ripped within about 4 days. The customer service team for OneTigris was incredible! They contacted me right away in regards to my disappointment that the handle ripped and worked with me to get a new harness. I had the new harness within 2 to 3 days for speaking with customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Power walking
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent product and everyone comments how cute my dog looks . Actually I was stoped a few times and asked where to get one like it . I put some weights on it so it increases the walking exercise. My dog loves it and when we go grocery shopping she helps me caring the goods.
customer_reviews.author: Ligia Sommers

customer_reviews.title: For huge dogs only
customer_reviews.text: Great design but I have an Australian shepherd/red heeler mix and it was almost the entire size of her. And it was heavy without anything in it. For very large dogs only. I had to return mine. Very disappointing. It would be great for a pit bull or a golden retriever or great Dane.
customer_reviews.author: Amber McKenyon

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Loved the fit, the pocket size, and durability. One thing I didn't like was the stitching on the D ring where you connect your leash. I have an 80 pound lab that walks great on a leash but gets so excited on hikes that she pulls some. The threading started coming loose before we reached our end, about two miles up. Nothing I can't fix, I just shouldn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Attebery

customer_reviews.title: New design is great!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this a while back as it looked like it could carry a lot and would be comfortable for my pup at a great price but ended up returning it because it was h u g e! However I now have the new and improved design and it’s now perfect! Fits my dog great now and is much more adjustable with a wider size range. Glad I gave it a second chance! Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the tactical harness but was in between sizes so had to settle on this. I am not disappointed though. It is of strong quality. The pockets handy and roomy, anything from doggy bags to water bottles to beers. I even use little dumbbells to add some exercise for my 62 lb muscular pit. The only issue is that I have alot of a slack on the straps to make it fit and the front neck strap has to be kinda tight to keep the harness up on top of the shoulders. Also extra bulk sometimes bumbs into me while walking.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot, very sturdy and build well, no issues or problems at all, I do wish it was bigger “pockets on both sides”, I should have read the size better, we have Great Dane and wanted something big like donkey packs so she could carry things for us here and there as she likes, this is pretty small, could fit a couple bottles, wallets, keys stuff like that, but we do think it’s great and have no complaints it’s an excellent product, will buy a bigger one exactly the same if they have it!
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Highly adjustable, great for growing dog
customer_reviews.text: Nice backpack for a dog, stylish and useful to carry supplies, and for the extra weight to tire out a dog with lots of energy. Not too big, but not too small, and super adjustable so I think it will fit our Malamute Golden mix into adulthood.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sample

customer_reviews.title: The build quality is very good as well
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this dogpack on walks for the past few months to carry my dog's treats, bags, leashes, water bowl and what ever else we need. It is very handy and convenient. The build quality is very good as well. She even likes wearing it when we go out. Used it on a few hikes as well, just know that the weight has to be perfectly balanced otherwise it starts sliding to the side. On long hikes this becomes a bit of a hassle moving things around every time she drinks water or something; otherwise the pack starts moving to her tummy.
customer_reviews.author: RIcky Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Adventures here we come!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this pack as soon as I opened it. Sturdy, and user friendly. My growing pup was a little confused at first trying to nip at it but after about 5 minutes off he went. Carrying water bottles for our hike. He’s a young Belgian Malinois, only about 35lbs right now so I had to really synch up the straps. I was able to tuck them away for now. Lots of room to grow. It didn’t slide around at all, stayed centered right on his back. No signs of wear on his coat.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Well built - Leans too much to one side though
customer_reviews.text: It's well built and sterdy, but ends up leaning to one side of our German Shepherd. She doesn't seem to mind, but it visually bugs the heck out of me to the extent that I'm not using it right now. I'll rig something up to keep it even - after that it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Fits Well, Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Large size fit fine on my 45 lb heeler mix. She seemed to be pretty comfortable with it from the start and didn't mind at all. Bag was pretty useful to store doggy snacks, water, waterbowl and everything else she needed. It's about she started pulling her own weight on our hikes!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Durable very nice pack
customer_reviews.text: Used this pack for hiking and running with my dog. Some complaints were with it shifting. I used a carabiner from D-ring on the front of pack to dog harness I already use with my dog and had no problems with shifting even when the sides were not the same weight. Note I would not let my dog run free through the woods with any pack as they could get hung up. Perfect for on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Bakerman

customer_reviews.title: Vintage Vibes
customer_reviews.text: So cute! The neck strap seems a bit oddly placed and kind of cuts into my dog's neck so I had made it a little more loose than it probably should be. Definitely have to even out the bag weight for each side though because it easily slides to the heavier side obviously.
customer_reviews.author: Tiki

customer_reviews.title: Dog packs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one for each of my dogs. I bought both large; one for a 68lb pit bull and one for a 75lb GSD. The one for the GDS does not have a lot of expansion room for the clip that goes around the front of her chest so hopefully she does not get bigger. They seem to be sturdy and well made. I'm working on getting them used to wearing the pack so they've only used them on short walks so far but neither seems to be bothered by them.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: 85lb lab, worked great!
customer_reviews.text: 85lb lab, fit great and had room to be tightened or loosened if you have a smaller or larger dog. Great product for the price! Sturdy and durable! Put bottled water in the sides and it stayed cold. My dog didn’t mind it, seemed comfortable. He pulls a little so I wasn’t able to hook his leash to the clasp on the back of the backpack, but that’s not an issue! Great bag for the price - would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but otherwise its a great product. Came packaged very well in a re-usable ...
customer_reviews.text: Have to make sure that you load it evenly or it will twist around while your dog walks, but otherwise its a great product. Came packaged very well in a re-usable bag. the canvas and stitching all look and feel like great quality materials, and it fits a barrel chested boxer/hound mix quite well, although near the end of its straps. this was a great addition to our hiking gear! Dog can carry his own food, portable water bowl, doggy bags, and water bottle (if you balance them).
customer_reviews.author: UtahMatt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Our three-year old German Shepherd weighs 85 lbs. This OneTigris Dog Pack is a perfect size for him. Plenty of room in the side pockets for water bottles, food and treats. Straps are long enough and adjustable; canvas bag has nice, strong stitching. Nitro is still getting used to the weight so he is only wearing it about 20-30 minutes each day. Today was the first day we went for a walk with the pack on. This pack is exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Karen F

customer_reviews.title: Tore easily
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for this harness to have my dog help pack some of his food when backpacking. However on our first trip with it, it tore when he saw a critter and chased it into a bush. Thus, living me with more weight to carry. Material felt tough but a getting caught on a bush can tear it apparently.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: For wide dogs only
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs this was the size for both of them. The straps are too long and I put it in my one dog It just kept sliding and it ruined their gait. I was really hoping this would work because I was wanting something that was simple for my dog to just carry their poop and some water unfortunately this didn't work. If you have a really thick dog this may work for them I have a bull terrier and it still was too wide for him.
customer_reviews.author: Abby H.

customer_reviews.title: Did not last a day
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 50 pound pup to start working with her to be a trail dog. She ripped out both D rings within 1 hour of moderate use the rings ripped out of the stitching so I am not sure if these were suppose to be decorative versus functional
customer_reviews.author: Justin Zappe

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect looks great
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is awesome. Fits perfectly on my 60lb boxer (neck 16.5” and torso 31”). I put 2lb weights in each saddlebag (that i took from my husbands weight vest). He carries the load without appearing to be weighed down. I only do 1 mile with him so far. If i go longer i may remove the weight initially or after that 1 mike mark until he gets used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Pontante

customer_reviews.title: I love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I love it so far! Got for our 80 pound retriever to go backpacking with us. Love how classic and natural this one looked compared to the bright colors and materials of some other dog packs. Fits him very well and he doesn't seem bothered by wearing it. Have just started to introduce him to it, so I will have to update later after our first official trek, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Mlw3hk

customer_reviews.title: Boxit approved!
customer_reviews.text: Our 8 year old boxit (boxer/pitbull) loves it! We put it on her for walks around town. She carries her own poop bags and a few water bottles to keep her from being to rambunctious and for when she gets thirsty. I water proofed it with silicone spray. And had to sew up the excess rear stap. I think this was made for fat dogs. But our dog loves it! Easy to care for. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H

customer_reviews.title: Best harness I've tried!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly durable harness! I've been searching for a harness for my service dog in training, and so many were very small for her shape, and seemed lower quality, however this harness is incredibly sturdy, easy to spot clean, and had lots of space for patches and to put things in the pockets. For the price, I would 100% get another one of these if mine somehow broke. This is going to be her everyday harness now, my favorite! Only downside is the fabric is a bit thick, and with her fur, she can get overheated when it's warm outside.
customer_reviews.author: Cece

customer_reviews.title: ... year old German Shepherd to help with training and better behavior on walks as Shepherds are know to need ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 3 year old German Shepherd to help with training and better behavior on walks as Shepherds are know to need a "job". This fits nicely on him without putting too much strain on his hind legs. It is recommended to have a dog carry no more than 10% of their body weight and this fits all of our essentials nicely. I took off one star because the bag does slide around a bit, needing occasional re-adjustment, and the straps that go around his belly hang a bit as they are very long. I may end up sewing those back so that they don't get in his way on longer hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Looks great - not really sturdy :(
customer_reviews.text: We chose to order this product for our sweet tempered lab who loves to hike. Wore it around the house for a few hours and seemed comfortable and sturdy. Took it out the next day for a hike and the leash ring broke within 5 minutes. It seemed sturdy but cannot handle a little tugging. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nick & Britt Lanza

customer_reviews.title: Durable pack definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought so my dog could carry supplies on hikes. Pockets are roomy and the zippers are nice - I can tell they won’t break easily. When the pack is on it doesn’t seem to bother her or be uncomfortable at all, which is extremely important
customer_reviews.author: Lexi Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is better than the other one we got
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor has these for their 2 dogs and I always see them walking past our house. So, I asked them where they got them and they said amazon and sent me the link. Yay! This is better than the other one we got. I ended up donating it to the shelter. This is very good quality. The material is more on the rough side, but affective. Sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: this is me

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: We loved this pack so much and always got compliments on it, but after just 1 year of use, the strap ripped and isn't reparable. We used the pack probably 20-30 times over the course of the year and it fit almost everything we wanted, but to spend money on a pack and have it break after such a short time is really a bummer. I'll give the brand another try but if the next one rips I'll give up
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: Love the look, but could be stronger
customer_reviews.text: I loved this at first, but after a month, the ring that you attach the leash to broke in the middle of a walk. I had a heck of a time catching my husky.
customer_reviews.author: Anysthasia

customer_reviews.title: Stitching ripped loose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack in January 2018 and didn't use it much, but today I put it on my 100 lb. Rottweiler and took her for a walk. She got excited when a dog passed and broke free of this pack. The stitching for the neck piece ripped out. Not very happy with its construction.
customer_reviews.author: Debra from Oklahoma

customer_reviews.title: Canvas dog pack = worth it
customer_reviews.text: 80lb lab wears it well. He pulls hard and this pack holds up. Tough as nails canvas. Two big pockets.. can fit like 6 cans of soup in each side. He carries his water, snacks, bog bowl + whatever extras we need on hikes. Worth it
customer_reviews.author: DougieDougDoug

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: Love this travel bag for our 29 pound Rat Terrier/Jack Russell. We hung it over his back a few minutes at a time until he got used to the weight of it before strapping it on. Now we take him walking wearing his pack so he'll be comfortable wearing it in case we ever have to use it as his emergency go-bag. It fits well, it's very durable and has lots and lots of pockets. I couldn't be happier with this product.
customer_reviews.author: MARIA

customer_reviews.title: dog doesn't mind it at all!
customer_reviews.text: Seems comfortable. Holds a variety of items. Stays on even when our dog rolls in the grass. Only issue is the EXTRA long straps. We tie them up so they don't drag. Pack could be a bit tighter, but as long as you keep the weight equal on each side, it stays in place very well.
customer_reviews.author: RHINO MOM

customer_reviews.title: Compact, well-made, attractive.
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I wanted. It's profile is compact so it doesn't get caught on things as LuLu walks by them much but when it does it confuses the hell out of her, which is funny. It's well-made and attractive. I'm going to add mole-skin to the inside of the straps for her comfort. I think the manufacturer might consider a soft inner lining on the straps. Dog bellies seem sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Great bag - your dog will be proud
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the largest size for my lanky Bernese Mountain Dog. It’s adjustable, so I had plenty of slack to make it larger or smaller. The quality of the canvas is great - nice and heavyweight. It is not waterproof, so make sure your dog will wait to take it off before jumping in a lake! My favorite thing about this backpack is how much my dog loves it and the new responsibilities she has. As evidenced in the photo below, she is so proud! I think you’ll be shocked at how much your pup likes having her own job!
customer_reviews.author: abedelia

customer_reviews.title: Fits my pitbull perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well during our camping trip. Dog didn't mind wearing it and I liked that he hauled his own water and food. My 85lb pit is on the big side and this fit him very well.
customer_reviews.author: gwynromero

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t used yet but looks amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good just revived it shipped was amazing and breezy. The real test is taking it out hiking later today, let’s hope for the price it holds up!! Love the Velcro on the side pockets to make more secure but still quick n easy to get to. Sizing it Accurate. Front straps are a little weird you have to unravel and then wrap the around the main front part but makes it feel and look on my dog good like it’s not coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Holding up well so far!
customer_reviews.text: This product seems very well made and has held up nicely on a couple hiking trips. It’s not hard to balance the weight on both sides and even if the straps aren’t super tight, it stays on! The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is I think it’s not very breathable. The piece of fabric that goes over the dog’s back has no ventilation, so my dog heats up really quickly since he has thick hair also. Other than that it fits a lot of food, water, and gear with durable zippers (so far) so I would totally recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great pack!
customer_reviews.text: Stays in place. Will lean slightly to heavier bag side when walking, but much better then most with the sliding issue. Returned a cheaper pack for that reason, but will keep and use this pack. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Manfra

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Just got it in the mail and can’t wait to take my pup for a hike. The stuff has nice quality to it. Probably not so water resistance because of canvas material. But it’s a beautiful backpack with nice snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Great for GSDs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pack for my German Shepherds. My female is about 68 lbs. and my male is about 92 lbs. He is such wider in the chest and the pack is adjustable where it fits both of them. There is a zipped pouch on each side and we are able to fit water bottles and water bowls. We use this for hiking and it is wonderful! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kam Cas

customer_reviews.title: Stitching quality sub-par, needs to improve, Looks great though
customer_reviews.text: The straps are not strong. The front strap BROKE on the second use and now I dont use it to attach a leash. DONT USE AS LEASH POINT. Its still great to carry stuff around and holds contents very well. It also looks great and rugged. Unfortunately, I cant give it more than 3 stars due to the quality of the stitching of the leash points. I hope future versions are made stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Vargas-Torrico

customer_reviews.title: This is GOOD...
customer_reviews.text: I like the material and the general aspect of this saddle bag for my dog. She is 9 months old and weighs 50 pounds. it was easy to fit and will work when she is full grown... she had to become accustomed to the saddle bag as she wants to chew on it... but as she matures, I think she will be OK...
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Yelnats

customer_reviews.title: and I have found the rear one works best. Also
customer_reviews.text: I have a boxer/rotti mix and he loves it. We hike with 4 bottles of water, poop bags, snacks, and collapsible water dish. However, I believe the sizes run a little large. I purchased based upon the chart, and have a lot of loose strap on the back two straps. There are D rings for the leash on both the front and the back of the top, and I have found the rear one works best. Also, I haven't had to use it yet, but the handle on the top, and the pack itself, are strong enough to be able to pick him up if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: OneTigris Dog Pack Hound Travel Camping Hiking Backpack Saddle Bag Rucksack for Medium & Large Dog
feature_bullets: 【OneTigris HOPPY CAMPER Doggy Backpack 2.0】Size Large: 21"-31.5"/50-80cm (neck), 29"-36"/74-91cm (chest), 9.8"/25cm (back); Net weight: 19.7oz/560g; 2 adjustable straps fits for medium & large dog
【Dog Backpacks for Dogs to Wear】Two main zipper side compartments with semi-open pockets for carrying dog food holder, water, snacks, wast disposal bags, etc.

【NOTE for Dog Hiking Pack】 The handle is not used for lifting up your dog; Dog expert: For most dogs, 10% to 12% of their body weight is a good starting point. This would be 5 to 6 pounds for a 50 pound dog, or 2.5 to 3.0 kilos for a 25 kilogram dog, for example. Of course, the right amount depends on a number of factors, such as your dog's breed, physical fitness, and energy level.
【Multi-functional Dog Harness Backpack】Ideal for dog hiking, camping, long trail walks, backpacking trips, traveling or everyday use
【Dog Saddle Bag】High density cotton canvas provide a better holding for your beloved pet and do not hurt fur
